intro: Minuartia glomerata subsp. cymifera, commonly known as the clustered rockcress, is a low-growing perennial plant native to rocky and alpine environments. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The subspecies is distinguished by its dense, clustered inflorescences and hairy foliage. It typically thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to harsh, sunny conditions. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies of alpine flora.
